intro: Pittocaulon filare, commonly known as the slender pittocaulon, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, clustered in umbels, and typically have five petals. Pittocaulon filare is often found in wetlands and along stream banks, where it thrives in moist, sandy soils.
